title: Recover exact transforms from RandomCrop et al.
body_html:
So in at least some of the transforms.py functions (e.g. RandomCrop) the random numbers used to create the transformation are not stored. Thus it is impossible to recover what values were used for a given (augmented) image. This is something it would be very useful to have for the purposes of debugging/diagnostics, for example when you have a complex transform and want to ask 'which transform is my model having a hard time with'.

PyTorch devs, would you be interested in having this functionality added to the code base? What constraints would it need to satisfy?
